title: Talkin’ ‘bout emulation…
author: Unordinary
excerpt: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/emu64-xl/id6483251916?l=en-GB Also accepts loading disks now but it is kind of a hassle [media]
siteName: TouchArcade - iPhone, iPad, Android Games Forum
text: https://apps.apple.com/us/app/emu64-xl/id6483251916?l=en-GB Also accepts loading disks now but it is kind of a hassle “Kind of hassle” is an understatement! Polar opposite of Delta, extremely user unfriendly but I guess that’s how things were. Never had a C64, but this seems great at emulating the frustration of using a vintage home computer, including waiting several minutes for disks to load. All very interesting though and managed to get something running eventually. Looks like this on iPad:- Okay, well, the EMU64 is not so bad once familiar with entering text commands - it's a whole new world. Hit a snag with Ultima games which were on multiple disks - doesn’t seem possible to load them separately. However, some helpful people in cyberspace have formatted them onto single disks while remastering the graphics, so now Ultima III Gold is running: Except I’ve no idea how the game works, which again is all text commands. Fortunately the original manuals have been digitised, looks like I have a lot of reading. It’s like doing digital archeology. Staff Member Patreon Silver The release of Delta has opened the floodgates for discussions about retro gaming, emulators, and related subjects. To keep the Delta thread on topic, I’m moving posts about other emulators, retro games, etc. here. Please remember that specific talk about ROMs or BIOS (especially where to download them) is not permitted. That includes links, names of sites, and other direct information. We don’t want to get TA into trouble! I did message the dev of Spectaculator about adding games to it but I haven’t heard back yet before Apple shut down file access on iTunes or iexplorer I added lots of games manually to Spectaculator. Love that want a new emulator ! Thought we might have had loads more by now https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ad-boy-all-in-one-emulator/id6478694589 AD Boy updated: Emulator changes - Added Super Nintendo (SNES) support - Added auto save - Added quick save/load - Added export/import save file - Added fast forward to all systems - Added cheats to all systems - Added real time clock (RTC) - Added support for zip files - Fixed magnifying glass popping up - Updated controls layout - Better performance General changes - No internet connection required - Complete UI redesign - Improved user experience - Updated settings menu - Added language support: french, spanish, russian, turkish Great stuff thanks. Shame this doesn’t do genesis but handy it does master system. Gonna give this a go now Tried a few SMS but not working on iPad, though the others are fine. If Provenance came out then i'll; be happy as hell as that covers Atari/Genesis so what with all the others on Delta i'll be happy ! Hopefully we'll get another emulator soon Saying that MAME is the big one ! Would LOVE that sebgo and Stronsay like this. Nice find bit of a faff running games bit it’s okay for now. Pac-Man worked but no sound. Space invaders worked with sound. Shame I can’t get rid of the advert. like I say it’s fine until Provenance one day appears Nice find but happy using Delta for NES want a genesis emulator ! Staff Member Patreon Silver iFBAs https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/ifbas-arcade-emulator/id1491920707 Found this. Final burn. Downloaded it. Lots of Japanese unfortunately but imported all my roms and many are listed to play. Played a few games and works well. Worked out the icons for coin and start. Use the red icon to leave a game added all my mame games and a fair few are listed to work for me it’s a good app until a proper MAME app appears Edit - the games are listed in a weird order, not always alphabetical but it has the title also in english. Tried a few: Gauntlet, P-47 Aces, Bubble Bobble Symphony, 1942 and all work very well. Like i say is a good alternative until MAME Don’t think so. I’ve got no interest with the camera so never tried at all this other emulator looks good. Shame about the monthly subscription but I’ll see what it’s like without it just wish we had MAME ! like I say that final burn app is decent Share This Page
html:
1. https://apps.apple.com/us/app/emu64-xl/id6483251916?l=en-GB

    Also accepts loading disks now but it is kind of a hassle
  2. “Kind of hassle” is an understatement! Polar opposite of Delta, extremely user unfriendly but I guess that’s how things were. Never had a C64, but this seems great at emulating the frustration of using a vintage home computer, including waiting several minutes for disks to load. All very interesting though and managed to get something running eventually. Looks like this on iPad:-

  3. Okay, well, the EMU64 is not so bad once familiar with entering text commands - it's a whole new world. Hit a snag with Ultima games which were on multiple disks - doesn’t seem possible to load them separately. However, some helpful people in cyberspace have formatted them onto single disks while remastering the graphics, so now Ultima III Gold is running: Except I’ve no idea how the game works, which again is all text commands. Fortunately the original manuals have been digitised, looks like I have a lot of reading. It’s like doing digital archeology.

  4. Staff Member Patreon Silver

    The release of Delta has opened the floodgates for discussions about retro gaming, emulators, and related subjects.

    To keep the Delta thread on topic, I’m moving posts about other emulators, retro games, etc. here.

    Please remember that specific talk about ROMs or BIOS (especially where to download them) is not permitted. That includes links, names of sites, and other direct information. We don’t want to get TA into trouble!

  5. I did message the dev of Spectaculator about adding games to it but I haven’t heard back yet

    before Apple shut down file access on iTunes or iexplorer I added lots of games manually to Spectaculator. Love that

    want a new emulator ! Thought we might have had loads more by now

  6. https://apps.apple.com/us/app/ad-boy-all-in-one-emulator/id6478694589

    AD Boy updated:

    Emulator changes
    - Added Super Nintendo (SNES) support
    - Added auto save
    - Added quick save/load
    - Added export/import save file
    - Added fast forward to all systems
    - Added cheats to all systems
    - Added real time clock (RTC)
    - Added support for zip files
    - Fixed magnifying glass popping up
    - Updated controls layout
    - Better performance

    General changes

    - No internet connection required
    - Complete UI redesign
    - Improved user experience
    - Updated settings menu
    - Added language support: french, spanish, russian, turkish

  7. Great stuff thanks. Shame this doesn’t do genesis but handy it does master system. Gonna give this a go now
  8. Tried a few SMS but not working on iPad, though the others are fine.

  9. If Provenance came out then i'll; be happy as hell as that covers Atari/Genesis so what with all the others on Delta i'll be happy ! Hopefully we'll get another emulator soon

    Saying that MAME is the big one ! Would LOVE that

    sebgo and Stronsay like this.

  11. Nice find

    bit of a faff running games bit it’s okay for now. Pac-Man worked but no sound. Space invaders worked with sound.

    Shame I can’t get rid of the advert. like I say it’s fine until Provenance one day appears

  14. Nice find but happy using Delta for NES

    want a genesis emulator !

  16. Staff Member Patreon Silver

  18. iFBAs
    https://apps.apple.com/gb/app/ifbas-arcade-emulator/id1491920707

    Found this. Final burn. Downloaded it. Lots of Japanese unfortunately

    but imported all my roms and many are listed to play. Played a few games and works well. Worked out the icons for coin and start. Use the red icon to leave a game

    added all my mame games and a fair few are listed to work

    for me it’s a good app until a proper MAME app appears

    Edit - the games are listed in a weird order, not always alphabetical but it has the title also in english. Tried a few: Gauntlet, P-47 Aces, Bubble Bobble Symphony, 1942 and all work very well. Like i say is a good alternative until MAME

  20. Don’t think so. I’ve got no interest with the camera so never tried at all

    this other emulator looks good. Shame about the monthly subscription but I’ll see what it’s like without it

    just wish we had MAME !

    like I say that final burn app is decent

Share This Page
